definition: to leave the matter at that/to be prepared to let go/to be willing to take things lying down
good (virtuous)/benevolent/well-disposed/good at sth/to improve or perfect
to stop/to cease/to dismiss/to suspend/to quit/to finish
surname Gan/abbr. for Gansu Province 甘肅省|甘肃省[Gan1 su4 Sheng3]
to rest/to stop doing sth for a period of time/to cease/(imperative) don't

sentences.english: China refused to be mollified, insisting it was owed an apology and compensation.
sentences.chinese: 中國拒絕善罷甘休，堅持要日方道歉和賠償。

sentences.english: We'll not take your rudeness lying down.
sentences.chinese: 我們對你的粗暴無禮是不會善罷甘休的。
但是，日本方面也不會善罷甘休。

sentences.english: No they won't let go, it's beyond their control.
sentences.chinese: 不，他們不會善罷甘休，它無法控制的。

sentences.english: They won't let go, it's beyond their control.
sentences.chinese: 他們不會善罷甘休，它無法控制的。

sentences.english: On this day, however, Amanda was not going to give up.
sentences.chinese: 可今天，阿曼達不打算“善罷甘休”。
